parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Motion Sensor Sensitivity
parameter.description: The lower the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor. Available settings: 8 - 255.

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Motion Sensor Blind Time
parameter.description:
Period of time through which the PIR sensor is “blind” (insensitive) to motion.
After this time period the PIR sensor will be again able to detect motion.
The longer the insensitivity period, the longer the battery life. If the sensor is required to detect motion quickly, the time period may be shortened.
The time of insensitivity should be shorter that the time period set in parameter 6.
Available settings: 0 - 15.
Formula to calculate the time: time [s] = 0.5 x (value + 1)

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: PIR Sensor Pulse Time
parameter.description:
Sets the number of moves required for the PIR sensor to report motion.
The lower the value, the less sensitive the PIR sensor. It’s not recommended to modify this parameter settings.
Available settings: 0 - 3. Formula to calculate the number of pulses: pulses = (value + 1)

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: PIR Sensor Window Time
parameter.description:
Period of time during which the number of moves set in parameter 3 must be detected in order for the PIR sensor to report motion.
The higher the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor. It’s not recommended to modify this parameter setting.
Available settings: 0 - 3.
Formula to calculate the time: time[s] = 4 x (value + 1)

parameter.name: config_6_2
parameter.label: 6: Motion Alarm Cancellation Delay
parameter.description:
Motion alarm will be cancelled in the main controller and the associated devices after the period of time set in this parameter.
Any motion detected during the cancellation delay time countdown will result in the countdown being restarted.
In case of small values, below 10 seconds, the value of parameter 2 must be modified (PIR sensor’s “Blind Time”).
Available settings: 1 - 65535

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: PIR Sensor Operating Mode
parameter.description:
The parameter determines the part of day in which the PIR sensor will be active.
This parameter influences only the motion reports and associations.
Tamper, light intensity and temperature measurements will be still active, regardless of this parameter settings.

options.option: PIR sensor active during the day only
PIR sensor active during the night only

parameter.name: config_9_2
parameter.label: 9: NIGHT / DAY
parameter.description: The parameter defines the difference between night and day, in terms of light intensity, used in parameter 8.

parameter.name: config_12_1
parameter.label: 12: BASIC COMMAND CLASS FRAMES CONFIGURATION
parameter.description:
The parameter determines the command frames sent in 1-st association group, assigned to PIR sensor.
Values of BASIC ON and BASIC OFF command frames may be modified by dedicated parameters.

options.option: BASIC ON and BASIC OFF command frames sent in Basic Command Class.
Only the BASIC ON command frame sent in Basic Command Class.
only the BASIC OFF command frame sent in Basic Command Class.

parameter.name: config_14_1
parameter.label: 14: BASIC ON command frame value
parameter.description:
The value of 255 allows to turn ON a device.
In case of the Dimmer, the value of 255 means turning ON at the last memorized state,
e.g. the Dimmer turned ON at 30% and turned OFF using the value of 255, and then turned OFF,
will be turned ON at 30%, i.e. the last memorized state.

parameter.name: config_16_1
parameter.label: 16: BASIC OFF command frame value
parameter.description:
The command frame sent at the moment of motion alarm cancellation,
after the cancellation delay time, specified in parameter 6, has passed.
The value of 0 allows to turn a device OFF while the value of 255 allows to turn ON a device.
In case of the Dimmer, the value of 255 means turning ON at the last memorized state, e.g. the Dimmer turned ON at 30%
and turned OFF using the value of 255, and then turned OFF, will be turned ON at 30%, i.e. the last memorized state.

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: TAMPER SENSITIVITY
parameter.description:
The parameter determines the changes in forces acting on the Fibaro Motion Sensor
resulting in tamper alarm beig reported - g-force acceleration.
Available settigs: 0 - 122 (0.08 - 2g; multiply by 0.016g; 0 = tamper inactive)

parameter.name: config_22_2
parameter.label: 22: TAMPER ALARM CANCELLATION DELAY
parameter.description:
Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cacelled.
Another tampering detected durig the countdown to cancellation will not extend the delay.

parameter.name: config_24_1
parameter.label: 24: TAMPER OPERATING MODES
parameter.description: The parameter determines the behaviour of tamper and how it reports.

options.option: Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class / Cancellation is not reported
Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class / Cancellation is reported in Sensor Alarm commad class after the time period set in parameter 22 (Tamper Alarm Cancellation Delay)
Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class / Cancellation is not reported.
Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class / Cancellation is reported in Sensor Alarm command class after the time period set in parameter 22.
The maximum level of vibrations recorded in the time period set in parameter 22 is reported.

parameter.name: config_26_1
parameter.label: 26: TAMPER ALARM BROADCAST MODE
parameter.description:
The parameter determines whether the tamper alarm frame will or will not be sent in broadcast mode.
Alarm frames sent in broadcast mode may be received by all of the devices within communication range (if they accept such frames).

options.option: Tamper alarm is not sent in broadcast mode.
Tamper alarm sent in broadcast mode.

parameter.name: config_40_2
parameter.label: 40: ILLUMINATION REPORT THRESHOLD
parameter.description: The parameter determines the change in light intensity level resulting in illumination report being sent to the main controller.

parameter.name: config_42_2
parameter.label: 42: ILLUMINATION REPORTS INTERVAL
parameter.description:
Time interval between consecutive illumination reports.
The reports are sent even if there are no changes in the light intensity.

parameter.name: config_60_1
parameter.label: 60: TEMPERATURE REPORT THRESHOLD
parameter.description:
The parameter determines the change in level of temperature resulting in temperature report being sent to the main controller.
Available settings: 0 - 255 (0.1 - 25.5oC; 0 = reports are not sent)

parameter.name: config_62_2
parameter.label: 62: INTERVAL OF TEMPERATURE MEASURING
parameter.description:
The parameter determines how often the temperature will be measured.
The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten.
Available settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 seconds; 0 = temperature will not be measured)

parameter.name: config_64_2
parameter.label: 64: TEMPERATURE REPORTS INTERVAL
parameter.description:
The parameter determines how often the temperature reports will be sent to the main controller.
Available settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 sekund; 0 = reports are not sent)

parameter.name: config_66_2
parameter.label: 66: TEMPERATURE OFFSET
parameter.description:
The value to be added to the actual temperature, measured by the sensor (temperature compensation).
Available settings: 0 - 100 (0 to 100oC) or 64536 - 65535 (-100 to -0.10oC)

parameter.name: config_80_1
parameter.label: 80: LED SIGNALING MODE
parameter.description:
The parameter determines the way in which LED diode behaves after motion has been detected.
Values from 1 to 9 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion. No other motion will be indicated until alarm is cancelled.
Values from 10 to 18 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion and one short blink each time the motion is detected again.
Values from 19 to 26 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion and two short blinks each time the motion is detected again.

options.option: LED colour depends on the temperature. Set by parameters 86 and 87.
Flashlight mode - LED glows in white for 10 seconds.
LED colour depends on the temperature. Set by parameters 86 and 87.
Flashlight mode - LED glows in white through 10 seconds. Each next detected motion extends the glowing by next 10 seconds.
LED colour depends on the temperature. Set by parameters 86 and 87.

parameter.name: config_81_1
parameter.label: 81: LED BRIGHTNESS
parameter.description:
The parameter determines the brightness of LED when indicating motion.
Available settings: 0 - 100 (1 - 100%; 0 = brightness determined by the ambient lighting - see parameters 82 and 83)

parameter.name: config_82_2
parameter.label: 82: AMBIENT ILLUMINATION LEVEL BELOW WHICH LED BRIGHTNESS IS SET TO 1%
parameter.description:
The parameter is relevant only when the parameter 81 is set to 0.
Available settings: 0 to parameter 83 value

parameter.name: config_83_2
parameter.label: 83: AMBIENT ILLUMINATION LEVEL ABOVE WHICH LED BRIGHTNESS IS SET TO 100%
parameter.description:
The parameter is relevant only when the parameter 81 is set to 0.
Available settings: parameter 82 value to 65535 Default setting: 1 000 (1 000 lux)

parameter.name: config_86_1
parameter.label: 86: MINIMUM TEMPERATURE RESULTING IN BLUE LED ILLUMINATION
parameter.description:
This parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured.
Available settings: 0 to parameter 87 value (degrees celsius)
Default setting: 18 (18oC)

parameter.name: config_87_1
parameter.label: 87: MAXIMUM TEMPERATURE RESULTING IN RED LED ILLUMINATION
parameter.description:
This parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured.
Available settings: parameter 86 value to 255 (degrees celsius)
Default setting: 28 (28oC)

parameter.description: Indicating mode resembles a police car (white, red and blue
